title: A Geospatial Data and Model Hub for Online Geospatial Analysis
abstract: In recent years, the availability of online geospatial analysis tools has increased, allowing users to access and manipulate large geospatial datasets and perform complex analyses through Web-based interfaces. It is still a challenge on how to manage geospatial resources including data and analysis functions in a distributed infrastructure. To address this issue, the study proposes a geospatial data and model hub approach for online geospatial analysis. Two core components, named the Data Center and the Model Center, are involved. The Data Center serves as a data hub for integrating, storing, and sharing geospatial datasets and metadata. It employs Cloud-optimized GeoTIFF (COG) and GeoCube for efficient handling of cloud-based data organization. The Model Center as a model hub focuses on the registration and sharing of geospatial analysis models, facilitating collaboration and interoperability among models. Both components are integrated into an online cloud-based geoprocessing platform, named the Open Geospatial Engine (OGE). The applicability is demonstrated through a case study involving the discovery, access, and manipulation of large datasets and models.
